subject: Re: skeptic
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Yes... ;)

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi Kay.  Your boyfriend's opinion is one of the reasons why I put 
great weight on relevance 
> of content in a session.  For example, when I recently asked for 
Rees' great uncle to say 
> his name, and an immediate reply of "It's Chuck Clarke" is heard 
(even though Rees 
> referred to him as Charlie, both are nicknames for Charles) I think 
the odds would be quite 
> astronomical of that being coincidence.  Same goes for any of us 
asking a question, any 
> question, and receiving a relevant response ... it would be highly 
unlikely for it to be from 
> stray signals (of whatever flavor.)  
> 
> Then again, if he has trouble even hearing and/or agreeing on the 
content, it's going to be 
> hard for you to get him to view an answer as relevant, even when it 
is.  
> 
> Margaret
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psfponies" <psfponies@> wrote:
> >
> > I have let my boyfriend listen to some of my files. He cant seem 
to 
> > hear anything. (He is a bit hard of hearing) he is saying what we 
are 
> > hearing is skip from a cb radio or skip in general. Any imput on 
this? 
> > 
> > Kay
> >
>
